Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Father Michael Perry, Our Lady of Refuge Catholic Church, 2020 Foster Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11210.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Williams.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father Michael Perry, Our Lady of Refuge Catholic Church, 2020 Foster Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11210.


Council Member Williams moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 30, 2012 be adopted as printed by Council Member Mendez.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Mendez moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 30, 2012 be adopted as printed.

Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance

Introduction & Reading of Bills

Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city New York, in relation to requiring the department of environmental protection to notify water customers who ware owners of class 2 properties, by mail, of large charges that could indicate a potential leak.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of environmental protection to notify water customers who ware owners of class 2 properties, by mail, of large charges that could indicate a potential leak.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting employment discrimination based on an individual’s actual or perceived status as a caregiver.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting employment discrimination based on an individual’s actual or perceived status as a caregiver.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to special parking for accessible for-hire vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Special parking for accessible for-hire vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate to pass and for the President to reauthorize an adequately funded  Farm Bill that creates a strong and healthy food system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Reauthorize an adequately funded  Farm Bill that creates a strong and healthy food system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law legislation that would amend the State Election Law to modernize and streamline the procedures for the election night canvass and the reporting of unofficial election results.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Modernize and streamline the procedures for the election night canvass and the reporting of unofficial election results.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to requiring photoelectric smoke detectors in residential buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring photoelectric smoke detectors in residential buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the U.S. government to provide a remedy to the Guatemalan victims of medical experimentation conducted by the U.S. Public Health Service from 1946 to 1953.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Provide a remedy to the Guatemalan victims of medical experimentation conducted by the U.S. Public Health Service from 1946 to 1953.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for the creation of veterans treatment courts in every county in New York City, including the counties of the Bronx, New York and Richmond, to serve and address the increasing needs of the growing veteran population in the City.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Creation of veterans treatment courts in every county in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact A. 9804/S.7212, also known as the “Trafficking Victims Protection and Justice Act.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Trafficking Victims Protection and Justice Act. (A. 9804/S.7212)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting data related to sexually exploited children.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Reporting data related to sexually exploited children.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Gianaris, S.2513, and Assembly Member Simotas, A.4874, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue use of and convey certain park land”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Discontinue use of and convey certain park land. (S.2513/A.4874)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6436, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.9367-A, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to training of fire officers in cities of one million or more".
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Training of fire officers in cities of one million or more. (S.6436/A.9367-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a voluntary master environmental hazard remediation technician registration program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Creation of a voluntary master environmental hazard remediation technician registration program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to parking meter suspension.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Parking meter suspension.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.6294-A/A.9084-A, legislation that would prohibit public funding to facilities providing aversive interventions, including but not limited to electric shock therapy, and would remove such facilities from any registry of approved schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Prohibit public funding to facilities providing aversive interventions, including but not limited to electric shock therapy, and would remove such facilities from any registry of approved schools. (S.6294-A/A.9084-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all persons to wear a helmet while operating a bicycle.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring all persons to wear a helmet while operating a bicycle.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign into law the Weekend Voting Act, which would move federal congressional and presidential elections from Tuesdays to Saturday and Sunday.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Weekend Voting Act

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the New York Dream Act (A. 6829-C/S. 4179-C) to provide benefits to any children of a professional immigrant recruited to serve the United States through public service at the local, state, or federal level, regardless of their age at the time of arrival or at the time of application for benefits.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York Dream Act (A. 6829-C/S. 4179-C)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of S.2051/H.R.3826, the Student Loan Affordability Act, which would prevent the current student loan interest rate of 3.4 percent from doubling to 6.8 percent on July 1, 2012.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Would prevent the current student loan interest rate of 3.4 percent from doubling to 6.8 percent on July 1, 2012. (S.2051/H.R.3826)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass A.9869 and S.6868, which directs the State to reimburse the City of New York for the health insurance and supplemental benefits of New York City Off-Track Betting Corporation retirees.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Health insurance and supplemental benefits of NYC Off-Track Betting Corporation retirees. (A.9869/S.6868)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon employers in New York City to hire more workers over 55 years of age.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Employers in NYC to hire more workers over 55 years of age.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making police data machine-readable.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Making police data machine-readable.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the State Education Law, to change from mayoral control to municipal control of the New York City public school system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Amend the State Education Law, to change from mayoral control to municipal control of the NYC public school system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the consumption of alcoholic beverages by minors at private residences.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the consumption of alcoholic beverages by minors at private residences.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, Senate bill S.741-B, and its Assembly companion bill A.6394-B, in relation to the Rent Guidelines Board.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Members formally voted against this item: 
Council Members Oddo, Ignizio, and Ulrich.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Rent Guidelines Board (S.741-B/A.6394-B)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate to pass and for the President to reauthorize an adequately funded  Farm Bill that creates a strong and healthy food system.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Members formally voted against this item: 
Council Members Oddo, Ignizio and Ulrich.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Reauthorize an adequately funded  Farm Bill that creates a strong and healthy food system.
